channel.title: JumpForJoy C#
channel.description:
I'm developing a small game originally based from doodle jump, called 'Jump For Joy'. Just wanted to show it here and it would be nice if someone had some suggestions for me..
Right now the game itself acts like a client and communicates over UDP protocol with a server which puts all the scores on a site
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ekKPbZ8KnEc[/youtube] Note: it isn't as slow as the video tries to make you believe
Download (177.17KB): http://www.mediafire.com/download/kdu5k37bkwl302w/Release.zip
(server is up right now)

item.title: JumpForJoy C#
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Maybe this isn’t your goal, but the key to making a great game like this is not just randomly placing platforms. I might be wrong, but Jetpack Joyride does a great job at this. It places zappers in a way you can avoid them if you’re good (for the most part). I can tell you just checked a random number each cycle, but if you were to determine the horizontal placement based on the time since the last platform was spawned, you’d have strategic and fair gameplay.

Read full topic

I’m developing a small game originally based from doodle jump, called ‘Jump For Joy’.

Right now the game itself acts like a client and communicates over UDP protocol with a server which puts all the scores on a site
